column3: A-The first letter of the English and of many other alphabets.
A l- A registry mark given by underwriters (as at Lloyd's) to ships in first-class condition. Inferior grades are indicated by A 2 and A.
ABACTION-Stealing cattle on a large scale.
ABACUS-A table or tray strewn with sand anciently used for drawing and calculating and etc.
ABANDON-To cast or drive out or to banish or to expel or to reject.
ACTIVE-doing something; being busy or lively.
AQUA-Water; -- a word much used in pharmacy and the old chemistry in various signification; determined by the word or words annexed.
ARCANE-Hidden; secret. [Obs.] 'The arcane part of divine wisdom.' Berkeley.
ARCHITECT-A person skilled in the art of building; one who understands architecture; or makes it his occupation to form plans and designs of buildings; and to superintend the artificers employed.
CHALK-To rub or mark with chalk.
CHAM-The sovereign prince of Tartary; -- now usually written khan.
CHAMBER-To reside in or occupy a chamber or chambers.
